channel.title: 华尔街日报热门
channel.description: 用中文浏览华尔街日报热门报道

item.title: Breaking: Prosecutors charged the parents of Ethan Crumbley, the Michigan high-school student accused of killing four classmates this week, with four counts of involuntary manslaughter in connection with the gun used in the shootings https://t.co/seiUxCfGVF
Selected by the editors of the @WSJBooks pages, here are this year’s most distinguished works of fiction and nonfiction https://t.co/CG1HMeKwx0

Max Martin, the Swedish songwriter-producer behind hits by Britney Spears, Katy Perry and Taylor Swift, is tied with George Martin of Beatles fame for the most No. 1 hits among producers—and is poised to break the record https://t.co/WmhaWVtJbk
"They look like living conifer cones." The scaly, ant-eating pangolin is trying to usurp the giant panda as the animal kingdom's goodwill ambassador. https://t.co/GdXRuOVhT0
A roughly 40-acre Bahamas private island known as Little Pipe Cay, last listed for $85 million in 2018, is back on the market for $100 million https://t.co/EMqM3PgDnR

Scientists in South Africa tracking the spread of Omicron say they are seeing a rise in reinfections in people who had recovered from Covid-19, suggesting previous infection provides reduced protection against the new variant https://t.co/a2CksCF54G
The Senate passed an extension of government funding and sent the bill to Biden, averting a shutdown after resolving a standoff over vaccine rules https://t.co/h0v19cdVpR
China has long dispatched pandas to zoos around the world in gestures of goodwill. Taiwan's scaly pangolin now wants a shot at center stage. https://t.co/HkEghnSMKp

Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell had a strict rule for employees at his Palm Beach, Fla., estate: “See nothing, hear nothing, say nothing.” A former staff member described working on the estate in Maxwell’s sex-trafficking trial Thursday. https://t.co/5e6b4KgTZi
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/K8JGgzQ1fd
Meghan Markle claimed victory in her legal battle against a British tabloid that published a letter the former actress sent to her father https://t.co/Ucm1J0Mtj5
China has long dispatched pandas to zoos around the world in gestures of goodwill. Taiwan's scaly pangolin now wants a shot at center stage. https://t.co/L3ytuDI2by

Scientists in South Africa tracking the spread of Omicron say they are seeing a rise in coronavirus reinfections in people who had recovered from Covid-19, suggesting previous infection provides reduced protection against the new variant https://t.co/xRPoEk35UM
The U.S. and Mexico reached a deal to restart the Trump-era Remain in Mexico policy. Asylum seekers will be sent back while their claims are considered. https://t.co/Wofiq7S5MC
Democrats and Republicans reached an agreement to extend government funding through Feb. 18, the first step toward avoiding a shutdown this weekend https://t.co/EkZwDH83ek

Chinese authorities protested the departure of international women’s tennis amid concerns over the safety of star player Peng Shuai, while at the same time moving to suffocate a brief flurry of online chatter about the news https://t.co/fABN4ETUAu
Take an early look at the front page of The Wall Street Journal https://t.co/5xQPDPcm8q https://t.co/8x6btK5IwG
Glaxo’s antibody treatment was found to be effective against Omicron, setting it apart from therapies that appear to work less well against the coronavirus variant https://t.co/qY2TUC1zlL
Biden will require travelers to the U.S. to provide a negative Covid test within a day of departure and will extend transit mask rules to slow Omicron's spread https://t.co/t9yxEshGEl

Jeff Bezos said the National Enquirer tried to use embarrassing photos to extort him over his affair, and his team suggested the details came from a phone hack. Probes by the U.S. government haven't backed those claims. https://t.co/KktDNKQsEV

“I am very lucky in my life that I have benefited from second chances, and I am aware that other people don’t even get first chances.” Ben Affleck talks Jennifer Lopez, fame, infamy, addiction and finally getting satisfaction—or as close to it as he’ll get https://t.co/s8GwH2vqD0

Four people were injured after a decades-old bomb dropped from an aircraft in World War II exploded during construction works near the main train station in Munich on Wednesday, authorities said https://t.co/JM2Dzb3Gx2
Starting base salary is $200,600 for a software engineer at Amazon in Colorado. We sifted through hundreds of job listings to understand how companies are paying workers. https://t.co/gHWjEzTHmf
CNN suspended Chris Cuomo indefinitely after newly released records detailed his efforts to help brother Andrew Cuomo respond to sexual-misconduct allegations https://t.co/lC8wkZ0KGt

CNN anchor Chris Cuomo said being suspended by the network was "embarrassing," addressing the controversy over his role in the sexual-harassment scandal involving his brother, former New York Gov. Andrew Cuomo https://t.co/944CugHY7H
Square, the financial-services company co-founded and led by former Twitter chief Jack Dorsey, is changing its corporate name to Block https://t.co/LlfPc8SOUk

Federal judges would have to speed disclosure of stock trades and publish their financial-disclosure reports online for the first time under a bipartisan bill overwhelmingly passed by the U.S. House Wednesday https://t.co/t0kgS5Kjnu
Comedian Trevor Noah will return to host the Grammy Awards early next year https://t.co/PK1Bn3r7gF
Square, the financial-services company co-founded and led by former Twitter chief Jack Dorsey, is changing its corporate name to Block https://t.co/7RiFmMYuAe

Bad Bunny was Spotify’s most listened-to artist in 2021, making him the platform's No. 1 streamed artist two years in a row. Taylor Swift, BTS, Drake and Justin Bieber rounded up the top-five streamed artists in Spotify's 2021 Wrapped list. https://t.co/QDqCck628X
Democrat Stacey Abrams said she would run for governor of Georgia in 2022, her second bid after losing a close race in 2018 https://t.co/QkZ4krY1UA

A federal judge has issued a temporary nationwide block against a Biden administration mandate that millions of healthcare workers get vaccinated against Covid-19 starting next week https://t.co/i4vZyqIxTt

A woman using the pseudonym Jane testified in federal court Tuesday that Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell gave her money, bought her gifts including underwear and repeatedly sexually abused her beginning when she was 14 https://t.co/3q3xWoVE2X
Adele said she will perform at a four-month long residency in Las Vegas early next year https://t.co/5teetYMcDs

Americans saw China as the nation's top foe and their trust in the U.S. military dropped, according to the first major national-security survey conducted since the U.S. withdrawal from Afghanistan https://t.co/cPxvlbJ32e

Barbados, the "Little England" of the Caribbean, became a republic after nearly four centuries of ties to the British Crown, and the first former British colony to become a republic in nearly 30 years https://t.co/qXpSFY0DJi
Breaking: The first confirmed U.S. case of the Omicron variant was reported in California, in a traveler returning from a trip to South Africa on Nov. 22 https://t.co/fnb3r9C3r6
CNN suspended Chris Cuomo indefinitely after newly released records detailed his efforts to help brother Andrew Cuomo respond to sexual-misconduct allegations https://t.co/cq8kiBTsNU

Emma Coronel, the wife of Mexico’s drug lord Joaquín “El Chapo” Guzmán, was sentenced to three years in prison for her role in helping her husband pull off a spectacular escape from a maximum security Mexican prison https://t.co/ONllekus2i
Entrepreneurs applied for federal tax-identification numbers to register 4.54 million new businesses this year, U.S. Census Bureau data show https://t.co/PVcYAw9xbB
Former White House chief of staff Mark Meadows has produced records to the panel investigating the Jan. 6 Capitol attack and will appear for a deposition https://t.co/KBUCwrsPZK
From @WSJopinion: Lockdowns don't stop the virus, and vaccine mandates are hurting hospitals. The Omicron variant is no excuse for more of either one. https://t.co/kpsJVMiHG6
Hedge-fund billionaire and New York Mets owner Steven A. Cohen is backing a startup that wants to let investors trade stocks 24 hours a day, seven days a week https://t.co/kd1Vs0K3Da

Jeffrey Epstein's former pilot testified Tuesday that Ghislaine Maxwell was intricately involved in the disgraced financier's daily life, managing household staff and flying with him on a private plane that flew former presidents and celebrities https://t.co/8q93zUzgPB
One of the hottest real-estate markets right now is in the metaverse, where property sales in digital worlds like Sandbox and Decentraland are setting records https://t.co/SrN69Vga7t
Pop star and businesswoman Rihanna was declared a national hero during celebrations in Barbados as the Caribbean island became the world’s newest republic #WSJWhatsNow https://t.co/mBFY2VYNLO

Some alumni are pushing back against "intellectual monocultures" at their schools, withholding donations. "This is a battle for our culture and, in many ways, for Western civilization." https://t.co/BOOgdWtr4s

Some hospitals charge up to 10 times more than others for standard medical scans, according to a study of previously secret market rates. The findings confirm wide pricing gaps across hospitals and large markups by some of them reported earlier by WSJ. https://t.co/vWHCTuMkND
